description.narrative: Human Capacities are available for life saving of children, which contributes to Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, more children under the age of 5 years and women of reproductive age utilize high-impact, quality health and nutrition services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Human Capacities are available for life saving of children

description.narrative: The challenging environment and evolving needs in the country required a strong team with diverse backgrounds, specialized across all health and nutrition programmatic areas and in emergency and development response. UNICEF health and nutrition programme in Sudan is run by 41 high caliber staff members (41.5% female), deployed in the main office in Khartoum and in 6 field and 5 sub-offices across Sudan, with only 3 vacant positions which will be recruited early in 2022. 32 of the staff members are nationals while 9 are internationals from programme countries. Programme delivery was supported by 26 consultants and volunteers.;; | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:18/01/2022
